word_mean: 截瘫的：有关截瘫或有截瘫性质的，广而言之，有时也用以指有截瘫的人

sentence.Network_en: A passenger was injured so badly he will be paraplegic for the rest of his life.
sentence.Network_cn: 一位乘客受了重伤，后半生都将下身瘫痪。

sentence.Network_en: In Sydney Paraplegic Olympics, he won a medal in archery.
sentence.Network_cn: 在悉尼残疾人奥运会上, 他赢得了箭术比赛的奖牌.

sentence.Network_en: Joni Eareckson a teenager in a diving accident, has been a paraplegic for over 40 years.
sentence.Network_cn: 娇妮(JoniEarecksonTada)在少年时代,因跳水时发生意外, 四十年来一直四肢瘫痪.

entry.def: A paraplegic is someone who cannot move the lower half of their body, for example because of an injury to their spine.

means.word_mean: 1. a person who has paraplegia (is paralyzed from the waist down)
1. suffering complete paralysis of the lower half of the body usually resulting from damage to the spinal cord
